lesson: Unit 2 - Making Presentations and Reports Quiz

questions.question: What is important to do before a presentation?
How should you start a presentation?
answers: With a greeting and an introduction.
questions.correct: With a greeting and an introduction.

questions.question: What helps keep audience attention?
answers: Reading from notes all the time.

questions.question: What is a good way to end a presentation?
answers: Summarize key points and thank the audience.
questions.correct: Summarize key points and thank the audience.

questions.question: What should you do if you don't know an answer during a presentation?
answers: Say you will find out and follow up later.
questions.correct: Say you will find out and follow up later.

questions.question: How long should a presentation be?
answers: Long enough to cover the topic, but not too long.
questions.correct: Long enough to cover the topic, but not too long.

questions.question: What is a 'visual aid'?
answers: Images, charts, or videos used to support a presentation.
questions.correct: Images, charts, or videos used to support a presentation.

questions.question: Why is eye contact important?
answers: It helps connect with your audience.
questions.correct: It helps connect with your audience.

questions.question: How can you organize ideas in a report?
What tone is best for professional reports?
Why should you practice your presentation?
answers: To improve confidence and smooth delivery.
To memorize everything word for word.
questions.correct: To improve confidence and smooth delivery.

questions.question: What is important when using slides?
answers: Keep text short and use visuals.
questions.correct: Keep text short and use visuals.

questions.question: How can you handle nervousness during presentations?
answers: Take deep breaths and practice beforehand.
questions.correct: Take deep breaths and practice beforehand.
